input: Handle retail customer queries by sorting them, auto-solving common ones, routing tough cases to staff, and tracking every step for performance.

inputs.name: C
inputs.source_origin: Customer communication channels (email server, chat API, phone transcription service)

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Labeled examples of frequent query types
inputs.bound_reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

inputs.name: A
inputs.input_data: Pre-written response templates for common issues
inputs.bound_reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

inputs.name: S
inputs.input_data: Escalation criteria and staff assignment rules
inputs.bound_reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

inputs.name: T
inputs.input_data: Metrics to track (resolution time, escalation rate, etc.)
inputs.bound_reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

steps:
Uses: Input 1, Input 2
Action: Retrieve and validate incoming customer queries with metadata
Produces: Raw query records
Stores/Sends To: Input validation buffer

Uses: Input 3, Input 4, Input 1
Action: Apply classification model to determine query category
Produces: Query category labels
Stores/Sends To: Processing queue manager

Uses: Input 5, Input 2, Input 4
Action: Generate auto-response for common issues using template matching
Produces: Automated response drafts
Stores/Sends To: Response queue

Uses: Input 6, Input 7, Input 2
Action: Route complex queries to staff based on availability and expertise
Produces: Escalation tickets
Stores/Sends To: Staff inbox system

Uses: Input 8, All previous inputs
Action: Record handling steps and timing in tracking database
Produces: Query handling logs
Stores/Sends To: Analytics database

Uses: Input 9, Output 4
Action: Update performance dashboard with new metrics
Produces: Dashboard visualizations
Stores/Sends To: Analytics platform

[DEPTH STOP CONDITIONS MET]
execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:
1. Customer Query Content
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Customer communication channels (email server, chat API, phone transcription service)
   Input Data: Raw text/audio of customer messages
   Bound Reference: <Input 2>

2. Query Channel Metadata
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Communication platform APIs
   Input Data: Timestamp, channel type (email/chat/phone), customer ID
   Bound Reference: <Input 1>

3. Query Classification Model
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Machine learning model repository
   Input Data: Pre-trained text classification model
   Bound Reference: <Input 4>

4. Common Issue Patterns
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Customer support team
   Input Data: Labeled examples of frequent query types
   Bound Reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.
   Note: Used to train/update classification model

5. Auto-Response Templates
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Customer service department
   Input Data: Pre-written response templates for common issues
   Bound Reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

6. Staff Routing Rules
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Operations management
   Input Data: Escalation criteria and staff assignment rules
   Bound Reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

7. Staff Availability Data
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Internal HR system/calendar API
   Input Data: Real-time staff presence/status
   Bound Reference: <Input 6>

8. Tracking Configuration
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Analytics team
   Input Data: Metrics to track (resolution time, escalation rate, etc.)
   Bound Reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

9. Performance Dashboard
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Analytics platform
   Input Data: Pre-configured dashboard template
   Bound Reference: <Input 8>

Outputs:
1. Categorized Query Queue
   Type: Persisted state change
   Description: Queries sorted into processing queues by complexity/category

2. Auto-Response Messages
   Type: Triggered action
   Description: Automated replies sent to customers for resolved issues

3. Staff Escalation Tickets
   Type: Observable artifact
   Description: Structured tickets routed to appropriate support staff

4. Tracking Database Records
   Type: Persisted state change
   Description: Detailed logs of query handling steps and timing

5. Performance Metrics Dashboard
   Type: Measurable report
   Description: Updated visualizations showing system effectiveness

Steps:
Step 1:
Uses: Input 1, Input 2
Action: Retrieve and validate incoming customer queries with metadata
Produces: Raw query records
Stores/Sends To: Input validation buffer

Step 2:
Uses: Input 3, Input 4, Input 1
Action: Apply classification model to determine query category
Produces: Query category labels
Stores/Sends To: Processing queue manager

Step 3:
Uses: Input 5, Input 2, Input 4
Action: Generate auto-response for common issues using template matching
Produces: Automated response drafts
Stores/Sends To: Response queue

Step 4:
Uses: Input 6, Input 7, Input 2
Action: Route complex queries to staff based on availability and expertise
Produces: Escalation tickets
Stores/Sends To: Staff inbox system

Step 5:
Uses: Input 8, All previous inputs
Action: Record handling steps and timing in tracking database
Produces: Query handling logs
Stores/Sends To: Analytics database

Step 6:
Uses: Input 9, Output 4
Action: Update performance dashboard with new metrics
Produces: Dashboard visualizations
Stores/Sends To: Analytics platform

[DEPTH STOP CONDITIONS MET]
All DERIVABLE inputs have been decomposed into terminal USER-CONTROLLED or SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE sources. No undecomposed derivation chains remain.
